text: Thermal break materials (insulating pads, blocks, composite shims, structural insulation) per submittals
System manufacturer and load ratings match structural/architectural specs
Product certification or test data provided (e.g., thermal resistance, compressive strength)
Substrates (steel, concrete, aluminum) clean and prepared as per manufacturer's instructions
All mating components dimensionally checked for flatness and fit prior to install

id: C. Installation – Curtain Wall / Window Systems

text: Thermal breaks in aluminum mullions installed continuously without gaps
Insulating strips snapped or bonded into frame with proper compression
Frames and sills sealed to adjacent air/vapor barrier without thermal bridging

id: D. Installation – Steel Support & Connection Plates

text: Thermal isolator plates or bushings installed between cladding supports and structure
Insulating washers or sleeves used on through-bolts as required
No direct metal-to-metal contact between cladding fasteners and building frame

id: E. Installation – Balconies & Slab Edges (Thermal Inserts)

text: Thermal isolation elements placed per structural drawings at balcony/slab interfaces
Rebar connections pass through insulation with proper cover and spacing maintained
Joint treatment between slab and facade integrates with WRB/vapor barrier
All thermal break assemblies verified against shop drawings and manufacturer install guides
QA/QC and building envelope consultant sign-off completed before enclosing facade
Thermal break components labeled or tagged for traceability (if required by spec)
